title: Poop on the Shoe: A Potty Training Whodunit!
features: Poop on the Shoe is a potty training whodunit that follows the main character and his five friends as they try to determine who pooped. Whimsical illustrations and the simple, captivating dialog will keep your toddler turning the pages while learning the answer to the timeless question of "where to go."
description: Jeremy Blankenship wrote Poop on the Shoe many years before it became an actual book. But in 2017, Jeremy met digital artist Kim K. Whittemore at an art festival in Minneapolis, MN and brought up the book idea to her. Kim instantly loved the idea of the book and upon receiving the manuscript a few weeks later started sketching ideas to bring it to visual life. Almost a year later the book was finished. Poop on the Shoe was their first collaberation together, but also their first book experience separately.
store: Jeremy Blankenship (Author),  Kim Whittemore (Illustrator)   Format: Kindle Edition
